p.span: Apache ActiveMQ is a popular and powerful open source message-oriented middleware. Apache ActiveMQ is fast, supports many cross language clients and protocols, comes with easy to use enterprise integration patterns and many advanced features while fully supporting JMS 2.0, AMQP 1.0, MQTT, Stomp and REST.

span.span: Continued hardening of AMQP protocol support
Fixes to some memory leaks and deadlocks added
Latest release now supports Jetty releases in the 9.3.x family.

p.span: Apache Artemis 1.5.0 released with follow up of 1.5.1 maintenance release. Highlights:
The ability to broker to detect network failures was added
Apache Artemis 2.0.0 is planned which i
ncludes major overhaul of the Artemis addressing model
New model has been proposed and implemented, highlights include:
Better support for address naming across protocols added
Ability to define prefixes for specifying pub/sub and point to point messaging requirements added
Consolidation of JMS and other protocol management/configuration

li.span: Both projects are now base-lined on Java 8
Begin blogging about the ActiveMQ project on https://blogs.apache.org/

ul.li: Clebert Suconic was added to the PMC on Thu Oct 27 2016
Christian Schneider was added as a committer on Wed Jan 04 2017
ActiveMQ Artemis 1.5.0 was released on Mon Nov 07 2016
ActiveMQ Artemis 1.5.1 was released on Thu Dec 08 2016

div.p: (Most of this information is pulled from reporter.apache.org)
